content: Offerings of the Leaders

Now on the day that Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it with all its furnishings, and the altar and all its utensils; he anointed them and consecrated them also.
Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ households, made an offering (they were the leaders of the tribes; they were the supervisors over the numbered men).
When they brought their offering before the LORD, six covered carts and twelve oxen, a cart for  two of the leaders and an ox for each one, then they presented them in front of the tabernacle.
Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
“Accept  from them, that they may be used in the service of the tent of meeting, and you shall give them to the Levites,  each man according to his service.”
So Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
Two carts and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to their service,
and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
But he did not give  to the sons of Kohath, because theirs  the service of the holy  they carried on the shoulder.
And the leaders offered the dedication  for the altar when it was anointed, so the leaders offered their offering before the altar.
Then the LORD said to Moses, “They shall present their offering, one leader each day, for the dedication of the altar.”
Now the one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah;
and his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
On the second day Nethanel the son of Zuar, leader of Issachar, presented ;
he presented as his offering one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Nethanel the son of Zuar.
On the third day  Eliab the son of Helon, leader of the sons of Zebulun;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Eliab the son of Helon.
On the fourth day  Elizur the son of Shedeur, leader of the sons of Reuben;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.
On the fifth day  Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, leader of the sons of Simeon;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
On the sixth day  Eliasaph the son of Deuel, leader of the sons of Gad;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
On the seventh day  Elishama the son of Ammihud, leader of the sons of Ephraim;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
On the eighth day  Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, leader of the sons of Manasseh;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
On the ninth day  Abidan the son of Gideoni, leader of the sons of Benjamin;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
On the tenth day  Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, leader of the sons of Dan;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
On the eleventh day  Pagiel the son of Ochran, leader of the sons of Asher;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Pagiel the son of Ochran.
On the twelfth day  Ahira the son of Enan, leader of the sons of Naphtali;
his offering  one silver dish whose weight  130  one silver bowl of seventy shekels in sanctuary shekels, both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;
one gold pan of ten , full of incense;
one bull, one ram,  one male lamb one year old, as a burnt offering;
one male goat as a sin offering;
and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats,  five male lambs one year old. This  the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.
This  the dedication  for the altar from the leaders of Israel when it was anointed: twelve silver dishes, twelve silver bowls,  twelve gold pans,
each silver dish  130  and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the utensils  2,400 in sanctuary shekels;
the twelve gold pans full of incense,  ten  apiece in sanctuary shekels, all the gold of the pans  120 .
All the oxen for the burnt offering  twelve bulls,  the rams, twelve, the male lambs one year old with their grain offering, twelve, and the male goats as a sin offering, twelve;

and all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings  twenty-four bulls,  the rams, sixty, the male goats, sixty,  the male lambs one year old, sixty. This  the dedication  for the altar after it was anointed.

Now when Moses entered the tent of meeting to speak with Him, he heard the voice speaking to him from above the atoning cover that was on the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim; so He spoke to him.
